description: Demolition of the existing building and redevelopment of the vacant town centre plots for a mixed-use development, comprising of 1350sqm of retail and flexible commercial floorspace and 210 new residential units within a part 16 part eight storey building, part 10 part six storey building and a part eight part six storey building with associated public realm, landscaping, parking and enabling works
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The application has failed to demonstrate that the maximum reasonable affordable housing has been proposed for the scheme and has also failed to provide adequate justification for the proposed non-compliant mix of unit sizes. The application would therefore fail to meet the housing needs of the borough and wider London area, and would conflict with numerous Development Plan policies, in particular Local Plan Policies SC2 and SC3 and London Plan Policies H4, H5 and H10.

Reason : 2 - The proposal would represent an overdevelopment of the site and, because of its excessive scale, height and bulk and its inadequate detailed design, greening and public realm elements, would fail to deliver an enhancement to the street or surrounding town centre. The proposal would conflict with London Plan Policies D3, D4, D8 and D9, and Local Plan Policies CC1, CC2 and CC3 in particular, together with the intent of the Hounslow Town Centre Masterplan.

Reason : 3 - The proposed development would have a severe and unacceptable impact on the residential amenities of a number of neighbouring residential buildings, including Topaz Apartments, 80-84 High Street and 1 Prince Regent Road, by way of factors such as undue loss of light, outlook and privacy and a harmful sense of enclosure. The proposal therefore conflicts with Local Plan Policies CC2 and SC4 and London Plan Policy D6 in particular.

Reason : 4 - The proposed development would deliver a substandard quality of accommodation overall, particularly in respect of natural light levels, quality of outlook and the quality and quantity of amenity space. The proposal would therefore fail to comply with London Plan Policies D3, D4, D6 and S4 and Local Plan Policies CC2, CC3, SC4, SC5, EQ4 and EQ5, alongside supporting planning guidance and standards.

Reason : 5 - The applicant has failed to demonstrate that the highest standards of fire safety have been achieved and that future users would not be at risk from fire in the event of an emergency outbreak. The application therefore fails to meet the requirements of London Plan Policies D5, D11 or D12.

Reason : 6 - In the absence of fully completed, agreed and signed legal agreement to secure a range of key obligations and financial contributions, the application fails to comply with Local Plan policy IMP3.
